title: Integrating Cultural Contexts in Elementary Mathematics Measurement Concept Comprehension

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Most learners access via smartphones, targeting non-degree-seeking adult learners with an emphasis on instructional design competencies applicable to elementary education settings

learning_goals: Learners design three social studies measurement activities (e.g., surveys, observation checklists) reflecting diverse cultural backgrounds (Korea, Southeast Asia, Middle East), and submit results that meet four or more of five peer/teacher evaluation criteria (e.g., cultural sensitivity, validity, feasibility).
Evaluate the ability to apply teaching strategies that transition elementary students' informal measurement concepts to formal measurement

Learners can analyze three or more learning materials (PDFs, videos, quizzes) using smartphone-based accessibility measurement tools (e.g., WAVE, Lighthouse) in an online environment and develop a report that includes improvement plans meeting five WCAG 2.1 criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
